content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure! Below is a Julia function `clean_column` that takes a column name (`col`) as input and returns the cleaned version by performing the required transformations:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    # Convert the string to lowercase
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace any spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    
    # Replace any hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

### Example usage:

```julia
julia> clean_column(" My Column ")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("Another-Column")
"another_column"

julia> clean_column("   weird-name-and spaces   ")
"weird_name_and_spaces"
```

This function should work as intended to clean and format your column names following the rules you specified (lowercasing, stripping whitespaces, replacing spaces and hyphens with underscores).
